description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the security vulnerability CVE-2023-35644 affecting the Windows SysMain service, the following updates should be applied:

1. Identify the product version running on your system and confirm it matches the build numbers listed.
2. Download the relevant KB updates from the Microsoft Update catalog:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5033375](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033375)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5033375](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033375)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5033369](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033369)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5033372](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5033372)
   - And others as listed in the original post.
3. Install the downloaded updates.
4. Restart your system after installation to ensure the changes take effect.

**Details**:
- These updates patch an elevation of privilege vulnerability in the SysMain service, which could allow an attacker to run arbitrary code on the system.
- Ensure your system architecture and version correspond to the updates you download.

**Preconditions**:
- Verify that the system is impacted by CVE-2023-35644 and is running a compatible version.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the installation of updates.
